rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents any anonymous or public chatbot/agent from touching internal business systems.
rules.compact_rule: IF user.is_authenticated == false THEN DENY all access to chatbot, CRM, project_registry, employee_registry, time_tracking, internal_wiki; set Outcome = 'denied_security'.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures public/anonymous channels never leak personal, customer, or operational data.
rules.compact_rule: Anonymous or public-facing UIs/agents MAY expose only non-confidential, non-personal, non-customer-specific information (e.g. generic company/markets description); they MUST NOT query or relay data from CRM, employee_registry, project_registry, time_tracking or internal_wiki.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines how all system and API access must be controlled for the AI agent.
rules.compact_rule: Access to all core systems (CRM, project_registry, employee_registry, time_tracking, wiki, chatbot) MUST be enforced via user.system_roles and employee_id; IT, with HR/managers, centrally assigns roles; the AI agent MUST propagate the caller's identity and roles and MUST NOT bypass or elevate permissions.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents untracked or shared identities when using APIs/chatbot.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ALL business systems AND chatbot: user_account MUST map 1:1 to an internal employee_id; shared or anonymous internal accounts MUST NOT be used for operations that read or mutate business data.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines what employee data any authenticated employee (including via chatbot) may see.
rules.compact_rule: IF actor is an authenticated employee THEN employee_profile_view(target) via chatbot MAY include {name, email, location, department, basic_role, context-appropriate subset of skills&wills}; sensitive fields (salary, HR notes, full skills&wills where not needed) MUST be excluded unless actor has elevated rights.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Protects salary information, explicitly called out as confidential.
rules.compact_rule: Field employee.salary IS CONFIDENTIAL; IF actor.role NOT IN {HRAdmin, AuthorizedManagerOf(employee)} THEN any request touching employee.salary MUST return Outcome = 'denied_security' and MUST NOT reveal exact or derived salary values.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Protects HR-only notes from being surfaced by the chatbot or APIs.
rules.compact_rule: Employee free-text HR notes in employee_registry are for HR/internal managerial use only; chatbot/API responses to non-HR/non-manager users MUST NOT expose or summarize these notes.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Treats skills & wills as internal people data, restricting external disclosure.
rules.compact_rule: Skills&wills data is stored in employee_registry for internal HR/manager/chatbot use; it MUST NOT be exposed to guests or external systems except in anonymised/aggregated form, and internal exposure MUST follow the visibility rules for employee profiles.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents sensitive information being stored in a broadly visible wiki.
rules.compact_rule: Wiki content is for general process/knowledge; pages MUST NOT include highly sensitive data such as individual salaries or confidential HR details; any AI agent that creates/edits wiki pages MUST filter out such data.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Preserves integrity and auditability of time tracking data, which the agent may update.
rules.compact_rule: IF time_entry.status IN {'approved','invoiced'} THEN direct modification by employees or chatbot is FORBIDDEN; corrections MUST follow the official correction workflow (e.g. create voided + new correcting entry) and maintain full audit trail.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents project leads (or an agent acting for them) from finalizing other people’s timesheets.
rules.compact_rule: Project leads MAY create or edit DRAFT time entries for team_members, but submit_time_entries(on_behalf_of_others) is NOT permitted; chatbot/agent MUST enforce that only the owning employee (or authorized approver according to policy) can submit their entries.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures that any state-changing action the agent performs is permission-checked.
rules.compact_rule: BEFORE executing mutating operations (e.g. update_employee_info, change_employee_location, update_project_team_or_status, create_or_update_time_entry) the chatbot/agent MUST verify that actor has the required system_role(s); IF not authorized THEN do not perform the change and return Outcome = 'denied_security'.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Standardizes how security denials are represented and prevents data leakage in error paths.
rules.compact_rule: All chatbot/API responses MUST set Outcome ∈ {'ok_answer','ok_not_found','denied_security','none_clarification_needed','none_unsupported','error_internal'}; when access is blocked by policy, Outcome MUST be 'denied_security' and the message MUST NOT leak restricted data beyond explaining that access is not allowed.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Keeps each system as the single source of truth and maintains auditability of AI-driven changes.
rules.compact_rule: Writes MUST go to the designated system_of_record (CRM→customers/opportunities, project_registry→projects&workload, employee_registry→people/skills&wills/salary, time_tracking→hours, wiki→documentation); AI agents MUST NOT maintain conflicting parallel records, and all significant changes MUST record changed_by = acting_user_id (or dedicated service account) for audit.
